intro: Chenopodium fremontii var. pringlei, commonly known as Pringle's goosefoot, is a species of flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant has alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters. It is an annual or short-lived perennial, and its seeds are dispersed by wind. The plant is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native range.
